name: Elena Perez
text:
This institution is wildly overpriced and not worth your time of day. They insist they have high standards for the diamonds they select, but they do not. Lastly, I believe they profiled my Latino boyfriend during our shopping experience.

To give some context, I sold high end jewelry for several years and helped with buying pieces for my store, custom designs for my clients, and sold many different watches and jewelry pieces from my store. I have a strong knowledge of diamonds and jewelry. I shopped at Bromberg in two capacities - both looking for an engagement ring as well as a simple bracelet repair. I'll start with the repair.

I brought my simple 14k gold bracelet to be shortened. The jeweler probably spent about 5 minutes to measure, cut and solder my bracelet together. I was charged $40. I also asked to be returned my spare gold. When I went to pickup my bracelet, they did not have the spare gold and told me the jeweler wasn't in so I could wait for a call. When I didn't receive a call, I called them. They said the jeweler knew about it and would find it for me. It took 4 days total and they then left me a message that "they think" they found it, but aren't sure, and asked me to bring my bracelet in for them to verify. I came in and the piece they had did not match, so they took my bracelet upstairs to go look, and did eventually find it. Overall this was a negative experience and the repair was much more expensive than either of the two jewelers I worked for personally.

Secondly, my engagement ring shopping experience. An associate (not Lemka) explained that they have a high standard for the stones they carry and the custom process if I were to go that route for the setting. The 2.01 carat D SI2 I looked at in store was priced well over $20,000, I can't remember the exact price but somewhere between 20-23k. When I went home, I pulled the GIA certification info on the stone and found there to be a massive cavity inclusion on the bottom of the stone that they failed to disclose to me. That cavity would get dirty over time and make the stone look worse. I'm disappointed they would even carry such a stone, let alone peddle it for such an incredibly high price. That stone was wildly overpriced as such and I wouldn't have purchased it, even at a deep discount due to the cavity.

During this visit, my boyfriend was with me looking at settings and diamonds, and briefly walked over to the watch counter to see what they had. When he started walking over there, one of the male employees shouted across the store for the security person to go over and stand by the watches. I felt awkward and insulted that they felt the need to call security over to babysit the area when we were already considering giving them our business on such a major purchase. I don't feel they would have had the same reaction if he was white and in a suit. Disappointing for it being 2020 and to still have such an experience.

After that event, I tried to give them the benefit of the doubt and went back to meet with the jeweler about a custom solitaire setting. He quoted me between 3-4K for a simple solitaire setting that I had handmade elsewhere for around $1550 from a well known local Chicago jeweler with a lifetime guarantee. Between the profiling incident and everything being wildly overpriced, I chose to take my business elsewhere. I love my 2.5 carat oval and custom setting I chose, and would not send anyone I know to Bromberg for any reason. If for some reason you insist on going there, be prepared to shell out extra cash simply for the mountain brook location, and be sure to work with Lemka.

resp.text:
Elena, we are so disappointed that you had a less than positive experience at our store. Thank you for bringing your concerns to our attention. I have passed your message along to our store manager.

We hate there was some miscommunication with your repair but are glad everything was resolved for you. As you can probably imagine, our jewelers see hundreds of repairs each week and occasionally slip ups do happen. Unfortunately yours involved an extra trip to the store to correctly identify your chain. We appreciate your patience with this!

We do regret we weren't able to find the right diamond and setting for you. All of our diamonds come with GIA certifications so we can be clear, upfront, and honest about every stone we sell. We try to keep a variety of diamonds in stock to fit all budgets and dreams, but we do sometimes have to order in more stones if we don't have exactly what you are looking for. You seem very knowledgeable about diamonds, and if you would like to discuss our stock and exactly what goes into the pricing, we would be more than to chat with you over the phone, in store, or by email.

As far as the profiling issue, all our staff members are trained to be aware of potential threats, and it sounds like this was not a threatening situation. We certainly do not make blanket judgments based on race or attire.  We make every attempt to make sure every customer feels welcome in our stores.  Please accept our apology for making you or your boyfriend feel uncomfortable in any way!

We are appreciative of your kind words about Lenka. We value her great customer service skills, and I have passed your positive comments about her along.

We are glad you found your dream ring even if it wasn't from our store. You are always welcome back to either of our locations anytime, even for free cleanings and prong inspection for your new ring. We sincerely hope we can help you again in the future with a better outcome!

text:
I was beyond impressed with Brombergs. My now fiance and I walked in one Saturday afternoon. She had no idea what she would want in an engagement ring. Angela was the one who helped us (But with every interaction I had with anyone from Brombergs I was deeply impressed) and she helped guide us even though at the time I was not looking to buy. I had actually planned on going online and picking something out that way. Except Angela blew me away with her customer service.

I ordered a custom ring and everything was perfect. The team got exactly what I was picturing in my head into an actual ring. It was quick and communication was always there. I would not change anything.

text: Purchasing from Brombergs was a pleasure. I purchased both my wife's engagement and wedding ring from their Mountain Brook store and she could not be happier. text: Shannon was great to work with from the beginning. After the first time we meet, she remembers your name and goes out of her way help make things as smooth and easy as possible. text: I was helped by Shannon while picking out my wife's engagement ring. I can not say enough good things about her and  Bromberg's - it's the only place I will use in the future and would encourage you to do the same!

name: Charles C
text: After looking around at many other places in Birmingham for an engagement ring (Diamonds Direct, Levis, etc) I ended up stopping by Brombergs because it was close to where I lived, and I thought I'd give it a try. It was a great decision that I would highly recommend to anyone. The atmosphere is very different than the other diamond retailers I visited. Instead of constantly being pressured to place a deposit on a diamond that was "an incredible deal that is here today and gone tomorrow" it felt more like I was working with a close friend that actually cared about my goals and was willing to answer all of my nitpicky questions without acting annoyed or rushed to try to land my sale and move on to the next customer that came into the door. If I were a new customer that was coming to give Brombergs a try, I would highly recommend working with Shannon. She worked with me throughout this whole process and helped me out more ways than I can count. I enjoyed working with Shannon so much that I asked it she would help me pick out the wedding ring as well as the wedding present. Long story short, Brombergs is a family atmosphere with reasonable prices and ask for Shannon!

resp.text: Thank you for your great review and kind words! We appreciate your business very much. Shannon is so knowledgeable, and we are lucky to have her on our team. We hope to help you again soon!

name: Rhonya
text:
I was looking  for the perfect Mother’s Day gift for my daughter who was expecting her first child. I knew I wanted to get her a necklace with the baby’s heartbeat. After doing some research I came across Mefford Jewelers. I read their reviews and decided that they were the best fit for what I was looking for. I am so glad I chose them. I reached out to them via email and text and Todd got back to me after a few hours apologizing for not getting back to me sooner. We corresponded via phone and text and he really made me feel at comfortable and made the transaction very easy. I wanted the baby’s name and date of birth engraved on the necklace as well, so he waited to complete the necklace until she was born. By the way I threw in a key chain for the dad at the last minute rather than wait for Father’s Day.  Baby girl was born 05/02 and I had both the necklace and keychain by 05/08. I will definitely be using Mefford Jewelers again in the future and I highly recommend them.
Thank you again Todd, it was perfect and they loved them.

resp.text: Hi Rhonya.  Thank you for reviewing us.  We greatly appreciate your kind words and look forward to serving you again!  Please contact us if we can be of further service/assistance and as always, thank you for choosing Mefford Jewelers!

The number one answer I received was Mefford Jewelers.

We could not have been more pleased.  Toddman Thompson, the manager, spent a considerable amount of time talking with us and making us feel right at home.  He even encouraged us to visit other jewelry stores to see what they have to offer in terms of products and services.  I'm so glad we did.  We saw a lot of nice jewelry and met a lot of nice people, but none that came close to comparing with Mefford.

My fiancee decided she liked a ring at Mefford best of all.  Ironically, we found a ring just like it at another Jewelry store in Florence, but Mefford had a much better price as well as service.  I was thrilled to purchase the ring from Mefford Jewelers because my fiancee and I both know it's top quality at a great price from a family owned business right in my hometown of Florence.

I would say to anyone looking for a jeweler to do business with in the Shoals area - visit Mefford Jewelers.  They will treat you right.  And I believe you will be so glad you did.

text: Mefford’s never fails to impress me with their unique and beautiful jewelry.  Their customer service is impeccable, and, every time I walk through the door I feel like family.  Love this store!!!

text:
This is an incredible, local Shoals business!
Russell and his staff are extremely knowledgeable, attentive, and friendly. I've used Mefford's new engaving for some promotional items for my business, which turned out very impressive, and I've also purchased beautiful hand-crafted jewelry for myself, and my wife. If you find yourself in the Shoals, and happen upon downtown Florence, you owe it to yourself to stop by the store. It's beautiful, and they have an amazing selection to choose from! Great job guys! My wife gets complimented all the time on her engagement ring,and I never get tired of looking at it either. Best customer service anywhere!!! My only regret is that I only get  to give stars. name: Alvin Apger
text:
Everyone that I saw, was very pleasant. Billy, the gemologist, spent almost 2 hours with me, discussing the process of taking raw stones, having a lapidary cut them into the desired shape, and choosing the metal for the pieces of jewelry. It was all very fascinating and never did I feel rushed to make a decision. Now I’m even more excited to see the final items! Will definitely return!
Thank you so much!
Christine

resp.text: Thank you Christine for the kind words! It was a pleasure, and we are excited to see the final results!

name: James P
text: Walked in the door seemed everyone was to busy to speak, walk to the counter stood there forever without  a "Hi we'll be right with you" on my long walk out still no noise from anyone was heard. The folks just around the corner are the ones who gained a very good customer. Sorry guys

resp.text:
James, we are sorry that you feel your experience was enough to merit giving us a one star review on this platform. We thrive on giving every customer a great experience when they're in our store, so we hate to hear you didn't get the same experience. When you called before you arrived, you mentioned you had questions about your rings, and we asked you to bring them by.  You said that was fine, and that it was nice outside for a good walk. When you came in, both of us were already with customers working on custom designs, so we weren't able to break away to help you right then, and we were the only employees in the store today. When you walked over to look at our men's ring display, I acknowledged you but I don't think you noticed, which is fine, it was a little loud in the store at the time. We hate that you weren't able to stick around for a few more minutes, because we would have loved to help you.

We hope that you did find the help you were looking for, because we know that is what's most important. We truly appreciate your feedback, and we hope you have a wonderful day!

name: James Havranek
text: Very friendly, professional, and courteous staff, who went out of their way to make me feel welcome and create my pieces. I received my jewelry, today, and am very pleased. They have purchased another piece with me in mind. I'll continue to use their services. And, many thanks.

resp.text: Thanks for the kind words, James! We look forward to seeing you again!

name: Cynthia Hibbett
text: Great experience!  They take care of their customers

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words!

name: Mary Ann Powell
text: I recently needed to have the watchband on my Citizen Solar powered watch repaired and was referred to CREATIVE JEWELERS (in downtown Florence, Al) by a friend.  The salesperson, Taylor Schweighardt, was extremely nice and told me they generally did not do watch repair, however he asked me what I needed. I explained that the clasp kept opening while on my wrist and I was unable to wear it for fear of losing it. Since the repair was not on the watch itself but only on the band he attempted to repair it right then but was unsuccessful. However, he offered to call Citizen and find out if he could get a replacement band (witch he didn't have to do). He called me the next day and said that Citizen had discontinued that specific band and they had nothing comparable. Since that was the case, I told him he might as well just dispose of the watch since there was nothing else that could be done. I thanked him for going out of his way to do everything he could to salvage my watch. At home I got on line and considered purchasing a new watch but changed my mind since I had another less expensive watch I could wear as a replacement until I could purchase something better. Two days passed and Taylor had called and left me a message to call him.  When I did he had good news.  He and the owner of the shop (Billy) had put their heads together and figured out how to repair the band. I was so surprised, I was speechless!  I went to get it the next day and asked  how much I owed them and they said no charge.  I insisted on paying them but they said no, but any referrals would certainly be appreciated.  They specialize in stunning hand created top of the line diamond and gem jewelry, and I might add, thoughtful, top of the line service as well!!

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words, it was our pleasure to be able to assist you!

name: Calhoun2
text:
The staff here is great! I carried in a ring that I'd bought elsewhere and they gladly sized it for me. They were very affordable too. I initially dealt with Taylor when I called for information about sizing. He was extremely knowledgeable and took the time to discuss options with me. Both the day I dropped off the ring and the day I picked it up, I dealt with Billy, the owner. Super nice guys, couldn't ask for friendlier, more knowledgeable Jewelers.
(The store's mascot, Bernadette, is icing on the cake!)
They have beautifully crafted, custom jewelry. Some pieces are truly breathtaking.
Stop in and look around or just go in for the friendly conversation. I highly recommend Creative Jewelers.

resp.text: Thanks for the lovely review, Christy! Stop by any time, we look forward to doing business with you again!

text: Great service that feels like they care for you the customer and the products they sell. It’s like going home and sitting down with family!

name: David Ferebee
text:
Too bad they don’t appreciate long time customers! My wife went in there days before Christmas and asked to have her  charm bracelet cleaned and a new battery for my watch. The watch, bracelet and ALL the charms over the years (20+)were purchased from this store.
She was told “we have not sold those items in years and would not be able to help her today”.
Maybe leadership has changed here from the beginning and relationships do not matter anymore.
I am not bitter, but disappointed that after my many years of buying my wife jewelry from the store it is over.
I am sure I can find another jewelry store in town as I still have many years left to buy for my wife.

resp.text:
David, I'm sorry your wife felt mistreated.  We did have a store full of customers when she was in during the week of Christmas.  We just cannot take someone away from a customer to clean jewelry or change a battery so we do it when we're closed.  As to the Pandora, we no longer have the equipment to properly clean it.  We have not carried Pandora for over three years.

We work very hard to do the best we can, and we're proud of the reviews we receive.  I am sorry you feel we dropped the ball this time.  I do appreciate your review and we will try to be better explaining ourselves in the future.  Richard Frank, Owner

name: Emily Suddath
text:
Goldstein’s helped me and fixed my problems when another local jewelry store failed to deliver the customer service I would expect. I cannot explain what sets Goldstein’s apart until I share the negative experience I had at another jewelry store in Mobile, so I will share that first.

Like I said, I had a ring repair somewhere else first. The other jewelry store not only sized my ring down (when I didn’t ask for it to be sized down), but failed to claim fault for it.  My diamond had fallen out of my setting and I asked the other jewelry store to reset the diamond and also solder my wedding band and engagement band together. When I got my rings back from them, my ring was a size 5 3/4 which is 3/4 smaller than the original size, which was a  size 6 (rings also fit tighter when they’re soldered together, so it fit much tighter than before.) I want to also note that their store never sized me in store either, but rather had the ring repaired with no size listed in their system. Goldstein’s makes a practice of sizing you and placing the size in the system, anytime you come in for ring repairs so that it is never your word against theirs.

When I came back to the other store, not only did they not apologize, they did not want to take apart my soldered rings and resize them individually (so as to protect the integrity of them) , but they recommended making the two rings into one. The sales associate also sized me as a size 7 which is A LOT larger than the size 5 3/4 ring they had sent me home with just a few days before!

I felt something was off with how everything was being handled, so I decided to not have my repairs done there but instead have them done somewhere else...which would be how I ended up at Goldstein’s a few days later.

When I went to Goldstein’s, they measured my finger and reassured me that yes, the other store had sized my ring incorrectly. The rings wouldn’t even fit on my finger without redness and swelling (which the other jewelry store associate said was due to having large knuckles, or perhaps even the humid weather.)

Goldstein’s assured me they stood behind their sizing methods. The other jewelry store actually told me they didn’t guarantee their fit and scoffed over the phone when asked if they guaranteed the fit. Goldstein’s on the other hand, said that they do guarantee the fit they size you with in store. They didn’t make me feel like I was being unreasonable at any step of the way, like I felt at the other store. They affirmed me, as one should do when providing quality customer service.

Goldstein’s measured me as a size 6 1/2  and I noticed they had a careful attention to fit, and also that their ring sizing methods seemed more legitimate than what I was offered at the other jewelry store (they used individual rings to size me at Goldstein’s, and the other store used a keychain of sorts full of various sized rings. I was more impressed with the Goldstein’s method because if you’re getting rings soldered together, you want to see how the two stacked rings will fit your finger and that they come off easily, versus what was offered at the other store, with only one ring being placed on the finger to determine fit.)

If I had gone through with the second round of repairs at the other store, I would have been paying for extra gold that I would have had removed anyway because they sized me as a 7, and my true size is a 6 1/2, as determined by Goldstein’s (my rings fit beautifully now!) Goldstein’s got it right the FIRST time versus the other store which didn’t get it right the first two times.

All this to say, Goldstein’s did everything correctly and professionally. They even texted me to see how my rings were fitting a week later. I call that excellent customer service.

If you want a correct fit the first time with no back and forth issues that make you second guess yourself, and if you’d rather have extra money in your pockets (unlike I do, since I had to pay for correct repairs that the other store failed to provide) then please, go to Goldstein’s!

resp.text: Thanks so much for the great review.  We are sorry you had such an awful experience at the other jeweler, but happy we were able to help you.  So glad you are able to wear your beautiful rings again.

text: We just picked up my 35th wedding anniversary gift at Goldstein's!  It was a very special experience.  Two weeks ago we walked in and spent time talking to Andrew about options to repair my now 37 year old engagement ring and possibly purchasing companion rings like the ones we couldn't afford those many years ago.  Andrew fully evaluated my ring and provided us several options.  We decided to remount my diamond.  He found the perfect setting and a ring guard that resembled the companion rings we remembered.  He was knowledgeable and patient.  Fast forward to today, we were greeted at the door by Andrew, the team was there, and Andrew presented my ring and new guard.  The quality is exquisite, my old diamond looks better than ever, and the ring guard accentuates the center diamond just as Andrew said it would.  We were so impressed!  Goldstein's is still Mobile's premiere jewelry store!

name: Georgina Anyidoho
text:
I have never been treated so badly and humiliated like i was at Goldstein's! If only I knew my experience with them later will be so emotionally and mentally traumatizing, I'd have never stepped foot in that store.
I had insisted I'd rather patronize a local business rather than purchase online contrary to what my boyfriend wanted. In the store, I chose a ring that was in the showcase. It wasn't my size so I was told they'd order one in my size, also the diamond for the ring was not kept in the store so i had to wait for over a month for it to come in store. Unfortunately my wedding was called off and so I decided to return the rings for a refund 6 days after purchase was made and three days since receiving it from the store. There is a 15 day return policy for a full refund. I was denied a full refund because as the store owner stated; " Its bad for my business" and offered a 50% refund instead, which i refused. I don't understand why I  should bargain for a refund I'm  entitled  to. When I insisted to be treated fairly and given my refund,the store owner  Richard Frank Jr,  made comments suggesting bias and racism against my color and country of origin.Insinuating I'm ignorant and stupid because I'm a foreigner from another country and had an accent.  I have never been treated like this in any other store environment and urge any other potential customers to beware and steer clear of this rude and racist  business. I find Goldstein's store profession and ethics to be unsatisfactory and many other reviews will state the same. Today I have formally lodged a complaint with the Mobile commerce department and will be taking Goldstein's operator Frank to court.

resp.text: It is unfortunate that we are unable to give a return on special order items.

name: V Bryant
text:
My husband and I have had a relationship with Goldstein’s for more than 37 years.  Prior to that,  my husband and his family had shopped there for more than 40 years.
To me,  Goldstein’s is like an extension of my family.  I am ALWAYS greeted at the door with a smile and they call me by my name.  ( That is an impressive start!) Even though I consider Angela my personal shopper, all the employees are very qualified to offer their services.
I have never been displeased with their service.  The line of products is extensive,  reputable,  and reliable.
Richard is the best “boss man” ever!  He is very soft spoken and polite.  He knows “his stuff!”  Richard can answer any question you might have and find any
product you might desire!
Angela is such a fine and outstanding representative of Goldstein’s.  She always takes the time to ask about me and my family.  She is sincere and genuine.  Angela wants me to be happy!!  And I ALWAYS am very happy and satisfied when I leave.
I cannot day enough about my experiences at Goldstein’s.  I highly recommend them to anyone!!  You WILL NOT BE DISSAPPOINTED!!

name: Raymond Weinshenker
text:
Having lived in The Mobile area since 1973, I grew up seeing Goldstein's pretty much my entire life. My first recollection was the opulence that was the gilt heavy barred store in Bel Air Mall near the fountain. Through the years I developed an appreciation for really beautiful items.
Not always able to afford, but always with an appreciation, I would stop in to see Richard and his wonderful team.
Fast forward to today, and I now know that affordable is available and BEST PRACTICES in customer care are the norm at my favourite jewelry store in the world.
I love my watches and the gifts that I have purchased from Goldstein's. If you've not been, GO and ENJOY what I know to be true. THIS JEWELRY STORE IS AMAZING!

resp.text: Raymond, we appreciate your continued support throughout the years! Thank you for sharing your story with us!

name: Corey Biggs
text:
Mobile is full of family traditions. One tradition that has stood strong, across the generations, is shopping at Goldstein’s, Mobile’s oldest jewelry store since 1879.

Goldstein’s has an exquisite selection of fine jewelry and watches. You can also shop for unique gifts, that is sure to please that hard-to-buy-for person in your life.

Wether you are purchasing diamonds and gemstones, precious metals, or gift accessories, the welcoming staff at Goldstein’s will be right there to assist you in your selection.

Goldstein’s premier services include jewelry repair, custom jewelry creations, and engraving.

Goldstein gives back to the community with its tradition of sharing, and support of organizations such as; The Boys and Girls club of South Alabama, and Penelope House.

My first purchase from Goldstein’s was 16 years ago with the purchase of an engagement ring.  It was the beginning of my family, as well as my tradition of shopping for family and friend at Goldstein’s.

Make shopping Goldstein your tradition, as Goldstein’s makes service to you, theirs!

resp.text: Thank you, Corey, for being a part of our family tradition!

name: Kaitlyn Parker
text: I had a great experience with Goldsteins jewelry and will definitely go there again. They have a large selection of many top jewelry brands at good prices. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful and they listened to what I was looking for and helped me find it without being too pushy. They even were nice enough to offer to clean a ring that I did not even purchase at their store and I've never seen it as shiny and pretty as after they gave it a complimentary cleaning! They answered all my questions and were just so helpful and knew what they wet selling. They have even sent me a personal handwritten post card in the mail to see how I was liking my new bracelet I purchased and to inform me of a upcoming sale they were having. I would definitely recommend Goldsteins jewelry to everyone. They are a very nice helpful and their location is convenient. I would definitely suggest going by and giving them a visit.   I'm sure they could find what you're looking for!

resp.text: Kaitlyn, thank you for the support, and really appreciate the wonderful review. We strive to maintain our relationship with our customers!

name: Mona Wade
text: I love Goldstein’s, o have only been a customer three times total, but it does not matter if your spending hundreds plus, or a mere twenty two dollars, they treat you like your royalty. Angela has helped me on my two most recent visits, one just a purchase of a little over seven hundred, but she listened and understood how much that purchase met and she worked with me to make it happen in a very Speical way. Most recent I was in the store looking for a replacement chain, sterling silver for my granddaughter, who has struggles with speical needs, Angela found the perfect little affordable chain to fit our needs, and even added a little piece of chain, so she could adjust it on her neck, didn’t charge us for her quick fix of placing the small charm on the necklace, that met so much to my granddaughter, I only paid for the small chain and we were out the door, as I was leaving she offered me a water for the road. That is such wonderful service, the kind you don’t get anywhere else. That charm was left at another store for over two weeks, just to be placed on a chain, when it wasn’t ready for my granddaughter’s flight, the jewelry store had a hard time finding our ticket and never seemed to mind, because we were only spending less then fifty. If ever I spend thousands, and I hope to do that one day soon, I will spend it at Goldstein ‘s. Thank Goldstein’s for caring about the person and not the dollar amount, and a special thank you to Angela, a fine representative of the Goldstein’s name. Sincerely, Mona Wade

resp.text: Mona, everyone who walks through our door matters! We look at all of our customers as they are family! I will be sure to let Angela know that you really appreciated her help! She is a great asset to our Goldstein's family!  We look forward to seeing you again soon, thank you so much for the kind review!

name: ashley
text: After researching jeweler's who specialized in custom jewelry design, my husband and I were very impressed with the reviews we read about Goldstein's. Unfortunately, our experience was nothing like the reviews.  We wanted to redesign/enhance my wedding set and explained what we were looking for. The store manager took one look at my set and informed me it would cost us more money to custom design a new wedding set using my original stones. She then proceeded to show us settings and told us if we wanted to use my diamond they could put it in one of the settings, made a "joke" that I could have two sets and decide which set I wanted to wear based on the outfit I was wearing. Showed us countless settings then informed us to draw a picture of what we had in mind and bring it in.  Throughout the experience, a price point was never discussed.  We feel the store manager made a judgement call on what we could afford based on my current wedding set.  Needless to say, we left feeling very disappointed.

resp.text: We apologize for your experience, Ashley, whilst an apology will regrettably not alter the outcome or your experience, I do extend it will all sincerity. It is through feedback that we are able to maintain and, when necessary, improve the service that we provide to our valued customers. Is there any way you could call us to discuss? You can reach us at 251-460-9050.

text: I had four watches that had dead batteries. I was able to get them all replaced in just 20minutes and it was a great deal at $9 each! They even tried to fix the broken rim on my Oakley sunglasses but weren’t able to weld or solder them properly and they didn’t even charge me.   Will definitely be using them for every future jewelry repair!

name: Marcus Kirby
text: Have had several watch batteries replaced and a ring repaired. Very friendly and affordable.

name: Dave Padgett
text: I have used Jewelry Repair Center for 9 years, to date. Replaced watch batteries, tightened ring prongs, cleaned very valuable jewelry, and sized my wife's wedding ring. All well done, with reasonable prices and within a very reasonable time frame. Nice people. I highly recommend them to you. NOTE: They also sell jewelry!!

name: Harmomy Vollmer
text: Great service. Great price. Fixed a family heirloom.

name: Nestor J. Delgado
text: Careless, irresponsible, poor service. Brought my brand new watch for band adjustment (remove links) and ended up with lots of scratches. Do not recommend.

name: Dana Trammell
text: I got a new Effy ring for Christmas but it needed sizing. It was a 7 and several places wanted to send it off for 3 plus weeks and other places were astronomical in price. I found this place and they do their service in house. It usually takes a couple of days for sizing. I tried on the ring sizes and settled on a 5 but when I tried it on was disappointed and wanted it bigger. I told the guy it was just too tight and I would be glad to pay extra but just needed it right. He asked if a 5 and 1/4 would work and I thought it would. He got me to come back in a couple of hours and it was perfect! He didn’t charge me any extra at all. These guys are very professional, fast, efficient, and know everything about jewelry and their prices are the best in town! Believe me, I went to them all. This will be my go to place from now on. I highly recommend this place.

name: Daniel Flynn
text: Got a watch as a wedding gift a couple years back and have never worn it. Decided it was time, but I had to get links removed. Then found out the battery had stopped. Took it here and they replaced the battery and the links within 10 minutes(was told by another company that I would have to ship it off and it would take 3 weeks or so to get back). So 10 minutes, and 17 dollars later, my watch was fitting and working. Can't beat that.

name: Milton Ware
text: They provided excellent, cost effective  repair service for a band replacement.

name: Angelica -Angel- Elizabeth
text: Been going here for yearrrrssss. They are so nice, and really do a great job for a fair price.

name: Susan Harrington
text: Fast service quality repairs.

name: Mitch
text: Great service, walked in and he adjusted my watch band then changed my three watch batteries right away. Reasonable prices. Would highly recommend.

name: Sheila Gordon
text: I have had several repairs done also several appraisals which all we're exceptional service and fair price, wouldn't use anyone else!

name: Scott Blakely
text: I take all my watches here. Fast, efficient, and affordable. My dad sends me his watches to be serviced here, also.

name: Carolyn King
text: This is my first time using Jewelry Repair Center. I was highly impressed with the quality of work and the price.

name: Kameron Smith
text: Walked in and he immediately started installing my watch battery. Great service and friendly. I recommend to all.

name: TOM SOMMERKAMP
text: Took my 10+ year old Seiko watch (my favorite watch) for repair and crystal replacement.  Not only fixed it, but did it in less time than expected.  Thrilled to have it back and looking good!  Will recommend to anyone out there looking for good work!

name: Marsha
text: Excellent very kind gentleman. Will definitely go back

name: Jennifer Martin
text: I bought a new ring from Jewelry Repair Center and am so ecstatic!  It is beautiful!  The guys Matt and David are really nice!  They do excellent work!  Will definitely use them again.

name: Esther Alsume
text: They were so awesome they fix the piece of jewelry that I needed fixed on my birthday they were quick fast and sufficient love the establishment definitely will come back

name: Larry Marsili
text: I've purchased a number of pieces of jewelry from David over the years.  He has always been honest and straight-forward in our dealings.  I send family and friends alike to them with confidence for their jewelry needs.

name: Erin England
text: Wonderful service. I have used this company for all my repair needs for several years now and they are my first stop for purchasing jewelry as well. Very knowledgeable and experienced. Whether you broke a necklace at church or a diamond fell out of a complicated ring, they can fix it. Custom designs available as well. Happy to claim them as my jeweler.

name: Maria Gillespie
text: I’ve gone to Matt and Dave several times throughout the years, they’ve  fixed necklaces for me, watches for my husband and I’ve even bought a couple pieces from them. Always great business and fair prices. 10/10

name: Laron Hardy
text: Great people!  Very honest.  Always helpful.  Highly recommend them.

name: The Stig
text: I have done business with David and Matt many times for everything from removing links from watch bands to sizing rings to replacing lost diamonds. Every time without fail they have been nothing less than spectacular! They are honest, friendly and do very high quality work which they stand behind. They are more than fair with their pricing which keeps people coming back and referring others. I highly recommend them to anyone needing any type of jewelry repair.

name: Ron B
text:
I've used these guys on more than one occasion. Once to replace the crystal and battery on my Fossil watch, and they were also able to polish the links to bring it back to life. Again to purchase two wedding bands, and to have the stone placed in the setting of an engagement ring. And another for the repair of two rings that involved reforming the ring to size and replacing a few stones.

All three times the two guys working the counter were nothing more than helpful. I saw where someone said that they were intimidating. I am 6'5" and the owner was a little bigger than me, so if they were insecure about themselves, then maybe but they were friendly on the phone and in person and talked to me no different than they might a friend. So if personable and joking customer service isn't your thing then maybe they're not for you. But the price was right and the work and service was great.

name: Tina Simmons
text: Great, Great work...Would definitely refer a friend

name: Youlunda Haygood
text: Friendly staff and great prices on repair, batteries, and ring sizing, and very fast. I had an excellent experien and highly recommend them.

name: W.J. Carpenter
text: Let me start off by saying that if you need a watch repaired, look no further than Jewelry Repair Center. With no appointment, I walked in, presented the staff with my broken watch (which they'd never repaired before), and within 10 minutes, my watch was working again. The entire staff is incredibly professional, extremely talented, very pleasant, and eager to serve. I won't say how much the repair cost me, but I will say that their amazing generosity not only surprised me, but completely humbled me (particularly given this strained economic time in which we're living). A big thanks to the staff at JRC; you all really made my day.

name: Jay Dub
text: Huntsville's hidden gem! Unparalleled customer service! Big thanks to Matthew for stopping everything he was doing to assist me! (Been looking for a jeweler to replace my Invicta battery after purchasing the watch well over MSRP at Zales... And of course Zales discontuned support for the watch due to it's size)... Will definitely be returning! A+ business!

name: Pwncake Ironfarts
text: I've had my battery replaced several times by these guys. Every time, it's no appointment needed and in and out within 10 minutes. I tried Walmart only to discover that they "can't" work on Fossil or Relic watches before discovering these guys. These guys didn't even blink. I would highly recommend these guys and will be taking any future jewelry repairs to them!

name: Caleb Doerr
text: Fast, simple, and easy watch battery replacement

name: Tracy Crews
text: Three times now I have used the Jewelry Repair Center. Simple to complex, and all three times were pleasantly and professionally handled. I recommend.

name: Yolanda Black
text: They have repaired gold chains, watches, added shanks to several rings and each time did flawless work. They have gorgeous new pieces as well!

name: george acker
text: broke my 1904 SR lever set pocket watch right in front of me  Brought it in to have it cleaned  running perfectly    Let the Owner look at it.   he grabbed the winder stem and pulled it out of the watch. had no idea of what he had in his hands. stripped the main set screw in it    FLAT OUT BROKE IT IN FRONT OF ME   STAY AWAY FROM THIS CLOWN

name: Junior Shepherd
text: Fast, Professional, and friendly staff. Went in to get a new strap installed on my Martian Notifier watch, and it took 5 mins, and only costed me 5 bucks. I did not have the pins needed for the install, yet they included them for free! I would recommend it to anyone in the Huntsville area for watch repair or upgrades.

name: Becky Hacker
text: I have been doing business with these guys for several years now and they are great to work with. Fair and honest business people.

name: Mr. John Howard
text: Took a timex chronograph in to have the battery replaced. I was in and out under 5 minutes for less than 10 dollars. Could not be happier. Also want to note, Kay and Zales jewelry stores neither could replace the battery without severely damaging the case. These guys have the tools and know how to do the job right the first time.

name: DA Kennedy
text: Took a watch in to be repaired.  It was ready the next day (as promised) at the price quoted.  Recommend them!

name: Andreas Schubert
text: Excellent and fast service. I had to replace the band of my watch and went to several other jewelers. Some were on vacation, some coudn't do it. Jewelery repair center could repair my watch right away. I will certainly come back.

name: Kelly Mattos
text:
In mid-late October 2013 I took my watch to the Jewelry and Watch repair center on University. The owner changed my battery and then admitted to me that he had broken the watch crystal (clear glass over watch face). He reassured me that he would fix my watch. He is a liar, thief and con-artist. In the almost two months that they were “fixing” my watch I went 3 times to try to get any information. Finally I just gave up and told them to give me my watch broken. The owner was rude, impolite and intimidating.
Whenever; I informed him that I wanted my watch immediately regardless of the fact that 2 months later it was STILL BROKEN. He said that he had tried to “make it right” and that he had been looking to buy me another watch from EBAY. The watch I have is a limited edition Android Prism watch that is no longer being made. He said that he had been unable to find any watch similar to mine. While I do not watch a watch from EBAY; I would like to point out that in the last 4 minutes I have found over 5 watches currently for sale on EBAY with the exact same crystal. These are not cheap Wal-Mart watches; he simply did not even try to find a similar watch.
The owner stated that since he had been unable to find a similar watch on ebay (lie) that he would have to send the watch out to Las Vegas to have a crystal custom made. If that was the case then why after 2 months was my watch still sitting on the counter? Why had they not already sent it to be fixed?  It does not take 2 months to drive to the post office. It is apparent that they had no plans on trying to fix my watch.
When the watch was originally broken by the owner, it had a tiny chip in the upper right corner. The watch has received even more damage since it has been in their possession. The original chip has spread to 3 times the size along with a new crack on the upper left. The back is covered in DOZENS of scratches and the hands do not seem to be functioning correctly.
The owner did not even try to fix my watch. He did not even offer a replacement. Under no circumstances should anyone ever go to these people. Now all I have is a broken piece of crap, and no way to have it fixed or repaired. They broke my watch and refused to fix it. These people are terrible.

name: Chung-thuy Pham
text: Went in for a watch repair, ended up learning quite a bit about watch movements and which ones to look for when purchasing a watch

name: Donna Butcher
text: Don't waste your time!  Had a necklace shortened & the 1st time I wore it, it broke & they want to charge me AGAIN to repair the break when I did nothing to cause it to break! Crooks in my opinion.

name: Sean Conway
text: Excellent

name: Jake Kincheloe
text: rude on the phone, didnt end us using them

name: Jesse Graham
text: Fast watch battery replacement, fair price, no waiting.

name: Joey
text: always treated me fairly

name: Kari Carter
text: Friendly and fast watch repair!

name: Maggie Forbus
text: Very reliable and fast turnaround.

name: Fred Lurenz
text: Common sense, cheap and old school!

name: Elizabeth Cain
text: Harold's is my go to place for jewelry repair, gifts, and design. They worked patiently with me each time I needed an individual's piece of jewelry for an occasion. Check them out, you will enjoy your visit.

name: Andrew Miller
text: Very friendly customer service.  I went in to have my 10-year-old watch battery replaced.  They quickly informed me that because my watch used a non-standard rechargeable battery, it needed a special battery from the factory.  I was given some very helpful advice to try to see if I could get it up and running on my own, before sending it in to the factory.  If mine wasn't a specialty watch, I have no doubts they would have it back up and running in no time since they seemed very knowledgeable.  They even cleaned my watch at no charge.  Very friendly and helpful!

name: Julia Simpson
text: Friendly staff and stunning selection of jewelry!

name: Martha Davis
text: They are so kind and courteous.  Great job on every repair.  They have beautiful jewelry.  Love Harold's!

name: Dustin Holmes
text: Best Jewelry Store in Town. Honest. Talented. The only Jeweler I go to.

name: Ginny Blackburn
text: My grand baby  broke the chain to an inexpensive  metal necklace that I like to wear.  Stopped in to ask Hatold’s for two small circle links to fix it.  It just needed a new small circle link on each side to connect the chain to the 1 oz metal piece.  This has happened to other necklaces in the past and I’ve gone to jewelers in B’ham and they repaired it on the spot and charged $0 - 5.     This jeweler said it would take a week to repair it and an estimate of $30 - 40.    I’ve dealt with a lot of high end jewelers, which this one is not,  but my guess, he will not be in business long enough to reach that status with such poor customer service and  attitude.  This jeweler and staff could greatly benefit  from a course in good business / customer service tactics.

name: Austin Decker
text: Honest people, quality craftsmanship and Great customer service we will be back!

name: Sarah Spratling
text: Very nice jewelry and knowledgeable staff

name: Tim Sabo
text:
great!!!!! from trace
cool!!!!!!!!!!!!! from trace
best jewelry store ever from your son trace

name: A. H.
text: Loved working with Frank, CC and Meg! Everyone was so friendly and welcoming. The selection at Frank & Co is extremely diverse and ranged from elegant and simple to bold, fun and flashy—perfect for a shop located in OBA. I stopped in to find a more durable alternative for my diamond engagement ring and made the switch from a white gold band to a similar platinum band. The price was just right and I’m so happy with my lovely forever ring! A must-see destination for tourists and locals alike!

name: Robert Delgirono
text: Great prices and great jewelry. The parking lot is too small though. Too bad every parking spot is free game to the public.

name: Caren Leon
text: Exquisite Jewlery. Excellent customer service. I really enjoy shopping in this store. I highly recommend you stop and shop here. You will be glad you did.

name: chris powell
text: I highly recommend this business. Great experience . My first time was repair work. I’ll definitely will be back.

name: Brenner Sweat
text: Great company! Very friendly and professional. Needed a couple watches sized and the service was outstanding. The owner is very knowledgeable about watches. Megan was very friendly and accommodating as well. Stop by for a chat. I’ll be back!

name: Michele Lartigue
text: The work David did to make an old ring new again went above and beyond my expectations! I could not be happier!

name: Victoria Mclaughlin
text: GREAT SERVICE!!!! Chatted with them before going to the store. Every step of the way they were very helpful, extremely knowledgeable, and got my ring sized extremely fast! Never made to feel like I didn’t belong in a high end jewelry store. Cheap pricing but excellent service and end result. Highly recommend!!

name: Christopher Schley
text: Amazing experience, Beautiful Jewelry, Outstanding Craftsmanship! I reached out to Frank yesterday for the first time in many years. He was willing and able to craft a beautiful Mother’s ring in 1 day and get it shipped just in time for my moms birthday. Frank and Co. helped me to fulfill a long time promise I have had to her! Appreciate it Frank!

text:
Victor, the owner of the store is honest, knowledgable and nice.
His customer service skills are impeccable. Treats customers like family.
Great assortment of Rolex watches with fair prices.
Watch repair services are great too!

name: Darcy Forsythe
text: I love our gym! Tito and Donovan make it real and fun..and look forward to going to see 'the boys.' See you in a few minutes!

name: Jeff Jones
text: You will NOT go wrong by going to Frank and Co.  Frank and his staff take the time to know exactly what you are looking for and strive for perfection.  If they do not have it in the store, Frank will personally make it for you or He will find exactly what you need.  I have used them for two VERY personal purchases and they take the time to size, engrave, create......whatever it takes to make sure that the most intimate gifts are one of a kind.  I will NEVER go anywhere else and encourage everyone to shop local!!!  This place is AMAZING!!!

resp.text: Jeff! Many many thanks to you for this stellar review! It’s truly our pleasure 🙌🏻

text: Frank and Company is an excellent jewelry store with something for everyone.  The staff, Frank, Jack, Bevelyn, and Page, are very pleasant and knowledgeable and willing to explain gemstones, metals and what makes each piece special.  They do beautiful custom work and stand behind their work.  They’ also repair watches.  The prices are fair, and there is no pressure to purchase.  It’s fun to just go in and look.  I highly recommend Frank & Co.

resp.text: Thank you Brandy!  We are always happy to help.

Harley Annette

The whole staff is great!!!

name: Albert J. Mcann
text: I've been a member here for several years. I still like this gym but try to avoid it during peak hours! My only complaints are that the wi-fi is terrible and when group exercise classes are in session you can't find space to do stretching!

text: Beautiful store,  beautiful jewelry. The clerks were very helpful and pleasant. We left a piece for repair and admired several others. Best marine life jewelry I've seen.

resp.text: Thank you, Cindy! It’s clients like you who make us our best 💎

name: Jerry Broadway
text: We were in town for a beach wedding.  Several hours before the wedding, I realized that I had not checked off one very important item on my Father of The Bride to-do list: picking up a ring as a gift for our daughter.  I frantically searched Google and found Frank & Co. I showed up at 12:30 with a picture, and they matched it as closely as possible. At 1:45, it was resized and gift wrapped. Fantastic service, and my daughter was thrilled with her ring!

resp.text: Jerry, it was a pleasure! Congratulations on the upcoming nuptials. Come see us again, and thank you for the amazing review 🙌🏻

name: Jane Taylor
text:
Wonderful store. Everyone is trustworthy. Everything is done exactly how you want it. I got a special ring worked on, and it was perfect.
They have never let me down.

resp.text: Thank you for the amazing review, Jane! It is always a pleasure to serve you.

name: Michaelle Leath
text: I had a loose stone that Frank mounted into a ring. He did an incredible job and the customer service was amazing. After having its size for my right hand I decided I wanted the ring to fit on my left. Frank had no problem resizing the ring and made it fit like a glove. They really treat you like family.

resp.text: Thank you Michaelle!! It was our pleasure to help! Have a great weekend.

As always Frank and Page take care of me!!!

I won't be back
